messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kind-of socializing

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/28/02 11:13:43 PM, mummyone24@... writes:

<< "But what about
socialization????" In which I would reply just as surprised and shocked
with, "Exactly!!!!! There wasn't one person I used that on that didn't get
my meaning and were virtually speechless!!! >>

That is PERFECT!!! <g>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kind-of socializing
messages.msgSnippet: As far as the socialization issue, I have a tendency to just laugh.  Do they think we homeschool in a
messages.messageBody:
<<From: Alan & Brenda Leonard <abtleo@...>

As far as the socialization issue, I have a tendency to just laugh. Do they
think we homeschool in a closet 24/7?>>


When we first decided to homeschool, of course one of the biggest 'mouth
wide open eyes bugging out' questions was about socialization. I learned
early on a good response. Generally the question goes, "But what about
socialization????" In which I would reply just as surprised and shocked
with, "Exactly!!!!! There wasn't one person I used that on that didn't get
my meaning and were virtually speechless!!!

Mary B

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kind-of socializing
messages.msgSnippet: ... For practical usage, I like this one.  Said politely, of course.  ;) But I though your cruelty is overrated was pretty funny! As far as the socialization
messages.messageBody:
> I've got several ideas, but some of them will undoubtedly cross the line
> into bitchiness.
>
> 1. "I don't agree."

For practical usage, I like this one. Said politely, of course. ;)

But I though your "cruelty is overrated" was pretty funny!

As far as the socialization issue, I have a tendency to just laugh. Do they
think we homeschool in a closet 24/7?

brenda
